data.title: Resolving absolute import path
support mime-type when showing source from non-files in editor
data.body:
If a debug adapter returns source from the sourceRequest, the debug UI only recognises the correct (language) type if the name attribute of the source has a proper file extension.
For this reason some debug adapters have to add an extension to the name artificially.

This feature request asks for a more direct mechanism based on a new 'mimeType' attribute on the SourceRequest response. If available the debug UI should configure the editor for this mime-type.

data.body:

- type 'ext '

data.title: Search / Replace: editors do not open when auto save is enabled
data.body: This makes it impossible to undo a replace operation. Need to investigate why editors do not open when auto save is enabled.

data.title: Whitespace symbols are missed in the middle of a text
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Win7 x64 Enterprise (also reproduced under Linux)

Preconditions:
1. User set following option:
{
    "editor.renderWhitespace": true
}

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create new file
2. Type few spaces, then few words devided by space, then few spaces again.

Actual result: whitespaces shown only before the first word and after the last word. No whitespace symbols between words. Screenshot: http://zoltor.org/scr/2016-06-27_115413.png

Expected result: whitespace symbol is showing everywhere in text where space was typed.

data.title: # ## Pound Hash signs should not be marked as comments in SQL
data.body:
MySQL uses # as comments along with the standard SQL '--' at the beginning. However, # is not standard SQL and therefore when using SQL Server/Oracle, etc. things marked with # are still shown as comment in the code even if they aren't comments. SQL Server specifically uses # ## to denote temporary tables.

Therefore, until someone figures out how to write a mysql exception to the syntax highlighting, I would suggest we suppress this code.

data.title: Allow to drag a file out of the window to open a new window

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
There are some issues with this approach:
- we need to explore if we can even detect a DND operation out of the window given we run in a HTML context
- we do not have a good story for having a single file open in a separate window because the entire project context is missing and the window has its own set of extension host and language services. as such this operation is not as lightweight as one might expect

data.title: extension host debugging: remote source maps are not used
data.body:
When debugging an extension, stepping into the extension host server code ends up in minified source.

The reason for this is missing support for loading remote source maps.

Before this can be fixed, the source map API must become asynchronous.
This is tracked with https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8162.

data.title: Loose IntelliSense for angularjs updating from 0.10.9
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
I´m moving from version 0.10.9 to 1.2.1 and I´ve lost IntelliSense information
1. Create a project
2. Create an angular 1 controller like this:
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6106661/16364726/95a2ab8c-3bee-11e6-979a-dcd5a0a5757b.png)
3. Create a jsconfig.json like this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6106661/16364735/aea05012-3bee-11e6-9dee-7cabcc511023.png)
4. Using [typings](https://github.com/typings/typings) install angular TypeScript definition

In version 0.10.9 IntelliSense was working in all places I needed in this controller.
It was working in angular:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6106661/16364791/9f44474e-3bef-11e6-9ade-d2ac896bb069.png)

And it also was working in injected dependencies:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6106661/16364798/c73f0fe0-3bef-11e6-9935-608f30801854.png)

From version 0.10.11 the IntelliSense information for the same file and same project is different.
It still work in angular but it doesn't for injected dependencies anymore:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6106661/16364807/0cd108ec-3bf0-11e6-93ad-be933c3ea053.png)

I've tried with versions 0.10.11 and 1.2.1 and it doesn't work.
I've checked the release notes from 0.10.9 to 1.10.11 and the main difference was the inclusion of Salsa, but I couldn't find any change I have to do in my project to keep it working.

Any suggestion?

data.title: Make source map handling asynchronous
data.body:
Currently source map handling in node-debug is synchronous which makes is difficult:
- load source maps from dynamically generated code that is only available via the node.js runtime
- to search the filesystem for source maps, source and generated code 
- load source maps via http

data.title: Compile errors are not supported by intellisense in real time
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0 insider
- OS Version: win 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a .ts file like an angular customer-edit.component.ts
2. Create another spec.ts file for the above .ts file.
3. Change the constructor of the customer-edit.component.ts by adding a parameter.
4. Open the "Error and Warnings"-Window
5. No errors are displayed although the spec.ts will not be able to compile due to a changed constructor in the customer-edit.component.ts.
6. OPEN the spec.ts file
7. Suddenly in the opened "Error and Warnings"-Windows you get the typescript error.
8. But thats far too late.
9. I do not want to click in every file to see the errors...

data.title: Error on Ubuntu trying to debug using GDB "Invalid launch option type, is not supported"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

I am quite new to VS Code and g++... so I am highly suspicious I am the problem. Submitting this issue because I am unable to find anything on SO, github, or google.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make a simple HelloWorld.cpp which contains hello world.
2. Compile using "g++: g++ -g HelloWorld.cpp".
3. Add the folder for HelloWorld.cpp to VSCode.
4. Go to the debug tab.
5. Add a debug configuration for "C++ (GDB)".
6. Modify the "program" field to point at the HelloWorld output. Mine is: "${workspaceRoot}/a.out"
7. Receive error: "error while processing request 'launch' (exception: Invalid launch option type, is not supported."

data.title: [emmet] Support all the features
data.body:
Adding support for all features of Emmet.

Source: #7909
## Description

Well, Emmet. Sorry, that one commit.
## What include?

All the features of Emmet:
- Expand Abbreviation ([Documentation](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/expand-abbreviation/), [Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362517/66ba1b00-3bb9-11e6-9698-2c951361965f.gif))
- Balance ([Documentation](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/match-pair/), [Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362534/c96ae72a-3bb9-11e6-8843-3410f1b9a75c.gif))
- Go to Matching Pair ([Documentation](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/go-to-pair/), [Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362542/f2ff5436-3bb9-11e6-9678-0a8203ea7997.gif))
- Wrap with Abbreviation ([Documentation](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/wrap-with-abbreviation/), [Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362563/8f8093ec-3bba-11e6-927e-a09f759a6901.gif))
- Go to Edit Point ([Documentation](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/go-to-edit-point/), [Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362574/deb58274-3bba-11e6-9c44-527430c38033.gif))
- Select Item ([Documentation](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/select-item/), [Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362575/07408e46-3bbb-11e6-87f9-77d261f1e7fb.gif))
- Split/Join Tag ([Documentation](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/split-join-tag/), [Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362580/3a249f28-3bbb-11e6-9a57-43bcf6511d2f.gif))
- Remove Tag ([Documentation](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/remove-tag/), [Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362590/62c94028-3bbb-11e6-935f-d1c02072151a.gif))
- Merge Lines ([Documentation](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/merge-lines/), [Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362594/7a4f0188-3bbb-11e6-94a7-4d759a13c82c.gif))
- Evaluate Math Expression ([Documentation](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/evaluate-math/), [Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362627/b8a5b124-3bbc-11e6-8e3d-dd109db769fd.gif))
- Increment/Decrement Number ([Documentation](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/inc-dec-number/), [Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362609/62a18302-3bbc-11e6-9c9c-752c331c585a.gif))
- Reflect CSS Value ([Documentation](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/reflect-css-value/), [Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362633/db1be9f8-3bbc-11e6-8459-dd490a5d0664.gif))
- Encode/Decode Image to data:URL && Update Image Size ([Documentation 1](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/base64/), [Documentation 2](http://docs.emmet.io/actions/update-image-size/), [Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362599/d10837c4-3bbb-11e6-8fac-f04d97f7dd09.gif), [Demo overwrite](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362603/28c300c0-3bbc-11e6-98e4-2a8279badd4a.gif))
- Update tag ([Demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/16362646/1bea3548-3bbd-11e6-8b0d-4c0b2e5522e4.gif), error: #8136)
## What's not included?

I am not binding keyboard keys as it can cause a conflict.
